definitions.definition: if a person or thing impresses you, you admire them or it
definitions.sensetop: impress (somebody)impress somebody with somethingit impresses somebody that…

examples.text: We interviewed a number of candidates but none of them impressed us.
The Grand Canyon never fails to impress people.
The Grand Canyon never fails to impress.
He impressed her with his sincerity.
It impressed me that she remembered my name.
I was young and easily impressed.
This game is his big chance to impress.
She impressed us with both the depth and range of her knowledge.

definitions.definition: to make somebody understand how important, serious, etc. something is by emphasizing it

examples.text: He impressed on us the need for immediate action.
Their responsibilities are impressed on them during training.

definitions.definition: to have a great effect on something, especially somebody’s mind, imagination, etc.

examples.text: Her words impressed themselves on my memory.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘apply with pressure’): from Old French empresser, from em- ‘in’ + presser ‘to press’, influenced by Latin imprimere, from in- ‘into’ + premere ‘to press’. Sense (1) dates from the mid 18th cent.
